page.title: 05Farming in the Codsall area
page.content: About 10 of the 12 sq.kms. are rural. Mixed farming is most important on many different sized farms. Among crops being grown in June l985 were grass for grazing,silage and hay, kale, potatoes, barley, wheat, oil seed rape, swedes, sugar beet and peas. Animals kept included sheep, store lambs,dairy cows, hens and horses. Dairying is important because of Codsall's proximity to the West Midlands. There are several riding stables. Codsall was once important in the horticultural field and nurseries belonging to Baker's Ltd. covered many acres. These were sold off during the 1960's. Baker's Way and Baker's Gardens are street names reminding us of those days. They are also recalled by the Russell Lupin, an attractive, multi- coloured flower which was developed in Codsall during the 1930's by the late George Russell M.B.E.
